title: Stranger Things season 4: First details of Hopper aftermath revealed
text:
Caption: Stranger Things season 4 episode count: First details of Hopper aftermath revealed

Rex

The supposed number of episodes of Stranger Things season four has been revealed.

With Netflix already releasing a teaser for the new season, (unconfirmed) details are starting to trickle in, and no doubt fans will be poring over every single thing.

The latest is courtesy of TV Line, reporting that season four will apparently be made up of eight episodes – although Netflix declined to comment.

While season two had nine installments, it matches the number of episodes for season one and three.

TVLine adds: ‘We can confirm that season four is slated to begin shooting in January and will likely wrap in August, which essentially rules out the possibility of the series returning this summer.’

So instead of a summer-set series like season three, we could be going back to the wintry depths like earlier episodes.

The finale of season three left viewers on a cliffhanger as Joyce (Winona Ryder) sacrificed Hopper (David Harbour) to save Hawkins from being taken over by the Mind Flayer and the USSR.

We might be getting another series set in winter rather than summer (Picture: Netflix)

Someone we only know as ‘The American’ was left to be held captive, and fans suspect that this mystery person might in fact be Hopper.

The Duffer brothers, who created the show, added fuel to the fire earlier this month with their latest teaser.

The official Stranger Things Writers Room Twitter account posted a photo that read ‘November 16th, 1983. Hawkins, Indiana,’ accompanied by the tweet: ‘Anyway I think you’ll – sorry I couldn’t get it done – but you mean so – and it’s been – hope this is – last until – love,’ – a sentence which has purposely left words out.

It came after fans claimed to have clocked Hopper’s car on the set of the show’s upcoming season, leading to more speculation the character is alive.

Stranger Things seasons one to three are available to watch on Netflix now.
